markdownRemark.html:
Large Hadron Collider Visual Music Machine is an Opensemble project.

Opensemble, apart from being an Algorithmic music collaborative ensemble is a framework for collaborative algorithmic music which employs the software engineering techniques used by the Open Source development model to discover the music that this kind of distributed and large scale collaboration can offer.

L.H.C.V.M.M. is a visual music project based on data generated by the Large Hadron Collider , the world’s largest and most powerful particle accelerator located at CERN in Switzerland.

Understanding Visual Music

It is the first prototype of Opensemble,

The goal was to translate the data generated by the ATLAS detector , one of the four major LHC experiments, into stimuli for the musical composition and performance.

Since we’ve begun, our intention has been to solve problems as they arise based on the needs of each individual project. Soon enough several questions emerged:  What common language could we adopt to describe a piece of music without tying it to a specific work?  How to translate ATLAS data into a descriptive piece of music to drive both music and visuals?  What will be the framework to manage collaborations in such a work?
